subhead: With two government ministers forced to resign and Russia's army approaching the key city of Pokrovsk, Ukraine's president is seeking reassurance from European allies, making stops in Greece, France and Spain.

Chile's presidential race heads to runoff between communist and hard-right candidates
subhead: Jeannette Jara, 51, a communist and former labor minister representing Chile's center-left governing coalition, won 26.85% of votes with 99% counted – insufficient to win in the first round. Hard-right ex-lawmaker and devout Catholic Jose Antonio Kast, 59, secured more than 23.93%. A second round will take place on December 14.

title: What is Europe's 'fair share' of climate action compared to other countries?
subhead: Europe produces only 6% of today's global greenhouse gas emissions, a point some politicians use to play down the continent's responsibility. Scientists counter that, looking at historical emissions, Europe still has far to go to meet the Paris Agreement.

title: Photographer documents the Bataclan's slow rebirth after the 2015 Paris attacks
subhead: Vassili Feodoroff has photographed more than 40 concerts at the Bataclan since 2023. Ten years after the November 13 attacks, he has become a privileged witness to the slow but unmistakable resurrection of a venue that has rebuilt itself alongside its audience.

title: London's 'mudlarks' scour the Thames for treasure
subhead: On the banks of the British capital's river, London's 'mudlarks' search for fragments of the past: ancient pottery, old coins, bone dice. These enthusiasts are less motivated by the value of the objects than by the stories they tell. Sometimes, their finds even end up in a museum, as is currently being shown in an exhibition at the London Museum.

subhead: Four years after presiding over this extraordinary trial, Judge Jean-Louis Périès recalled in an interview with Le Monde an 'almost miraculous' trial, where everyone 'played along, even the defendants.'

title: Ten years after terror hit, Paris has (re)claimed itself as the center of the world
subhead: From the 2024 Olympic Games to the bustling café terraces, the city has found countless ways to make love outshine death.

title: Vantara, an Indian billionaire's enormous private zoo
subhead: An international report highlights numerous irregularities in the mass transfers of specimens to the private facility in Gujarat, India.
